name: Andorra
facts: Andorra is one of the smallest countries in Europe.
It is known for its ski resorts and tax-free shopping.
The country has a population of around 77,000 people.
Andorra is located in the eastern Pyrenees mountains.
The official language is Catalan.

name: United Arab Emirates
facts: The UAE is known for its modern architecture and luxury shopping.
Dubai is famous for the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world.
The country has seven emirates, including Abu Dhabi and Dubai.
UAE is a significant hub for international trade and tourism.
The official language is Arabic.

name: Afghanistan
facts: Afghanistan is known for its rugged terrain and mountainous regions.
The country has a rich history, including the ancient Silk Road.
Dari and Pashto are the official languages.
Afghanistan is home to the Buddhas of Bamiyan, ancient statues carved into the rock.
The country has been affected by conflict for several decades.

name: Antigua and Barb.
facts: Antigua and Barbuda is known for its beautiful beaches.
The country has a population of about 100,000 people.
Antigua was once a British colony, gaining independence in 1981.
The island is famous for hosting the annual Antigua Sailing Week.
The economy relies heavily on tourism, accounting for a significant portion of GDP.

name: Anguilla
facts: Anguilla is known for its stunning beaches and coral reefs.
The island has a population of around 15,000 people.
Anguilla was a British colony and remains a British Overseas Territory.
The island is famous for its vibrant music and cultural festivals.
Tourism is a major part of Anguilla's economy, attracting visitors from around the world.

name: Albania
facts: Albania is known for its beautiful coastline along the Adriatic Sea.
The country has a rich history that dates back to ancient Illyria.
Tirana is the capital and largest city of Albania.
Albania is home to many UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including Butrint and Gjirokastër.
The official language is Albanian, and the currency is the Albanian lek.

name: Armenia
facts: Armenia is one of the oldest countries in the world, with a rich cultural heritage.
The country was the first to adopt Christianity as its state religion in 301 AD.
Mount Ararat, a national symbol, is located near the Armenian border.
Armenia is known for its beautiful monasteries, such as Khor Virap and Tatev.
The official language is Armenian, and the currency is the Armenian dram.

name: Angola
facts: Angola is rich in natural resources, particularly oil and diamonds.
The country has a diverse culture influenced by various ethnic groups.
Luanda is the capital and largest city of Angola.
Angola gained independence from Portugal in 1975 after a long liberation struggle.
The official language is Portuguese, and the country has a growing economy.

name: Antarctica
facts: Antarctica is the coldest continent on Earth and is almost entirely covered in ice.
The continent is uninhabited, except for temporary research stations.
Antarctica has unique wildlife, including penguins, seals, and various seabirds.
The Antarctic Treaty regulates international relations and preserves the continent for peaceful purposes.
Research conducted in Antarctica contributes to our understanding of climate change.

name: Argentina
facts: Argentina is known for its rich cultural heritage, including tango music and dance.
The country is the eighth largest in the world by area.
Buenos Aires is the capital and is famous for its European-style architecture.
Argentina is home to diverse landscapes, from the Andes mountains to the Pampas grasslands.
The official language is Spanish, and the country is known for its beef production.

name: American Samoa
facts: American Samoa is an unincorporated territory of the United States located in the South Pacific.
It consists of five main islands and two coral atolls, with Tutuila being the largest.
The official languages are Samoan and English.
American Samoa has a unique blend of Polynesian culture and American influences.
The economy is largely supported by tuna fishing and canning industries.

name: Austria
facts: Austria is a landlocked country in Central Europe.
The capital city is Vienna, known for its artistic and intellectual legacy.
Austria is famous for its classical music composers, including Mozart and Beethoven.
The country has a rich history and was part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
The official language is German.

name: Australia
facts: Australia is the sixth largest country in the world by total area.
It is known for its unique wildlife, including kangaroos and koalas.
The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, is located off its coast.
Australia has a diverse landscape that includes deserts, forests, and beaches.
The official language is English.

name: Aruba
facts: Aruba is a small island located in the Caribbean Sea.
It is known for its stunning white-sand beaches and turquoise waters.
The island has a dry climate, making it a popular year-round tourist destination.
Aruba is a constituent country of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
The official languages are Dutch and Papiamento.

name: Åland
facts: Åland is an archipelago in the Baltic Sea, belonging to Finland.
The islands have a special status and enjoy autonomy.
Åland is known for its beautiful nature and maritime culture.
The official language is Swedish.
Tourism, shipping, and agriculture are significant economic activities.

name: Azerbaijan
facts: Azerbaijan is located at the crossroads of Eastern Europe and Western Asia.
The capital city is Baku, known for its modern architecture and historic sites.
Azerbaijan is rich in oil and natural gas resources.
The country is known for its diverse culture, influenced by various ethnic groups.
The official language is Azerbaijani.

name: Bosnia and Herz.
facts: Bosnia and Herzegovina is located in Southeast Europe on the Balkan Peninsula.
The country has a rich cultural history influenced by both Eastern and Western civilizations.
Sarajevo, the capital, is known for its historical significance and cultural diversity.
The country is famous for its natural beauty, including mountains and rivers.
The official languages are Bosnian, Croatian, and Serbian.

name: Barbados
facts: Barbados is an island country in the Caribbean region.
It is known for its beautiful beaches and vibrant culture.
Barbados has a rich history, having been a British colony until gaining independence in 1966.
The island is famous for its rum production.
The official language is English.

name: Bangladesh
facts: Bangladesh is located in South Asia, bordered by India and Myanmar.
The capital city is Dhaka, one of the most densely populated cities in the world.
The country is known for its rich cultural heritage and diverse landscapes.
Bangladesh is famous for its textile industry and is one of the largest garment exporters.
The official language is Bengali.

name: Belgium
facts: Belgium is located in Western Europe and is known for its medieval towns and Renaissance architecture.
The capital city, Brussels, is the de facto capital of the European Union.
Belgium is famous for its chocolates, waffles, and beer.
The country has three official languages: Dutch, French, and German.
Belgium has a rich artistic heritage, producing famous artists like Magritte and Van Eyck.

name: Burkina Faso
facts: Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa.
The capital city is Ouagadougou.
The country is known for its vibrant music and arts scene.
Burkina Faso has a diverse culture with over 60 ethnic groups.
The official language is French.

name: Bulgaria
facts: Bulgaria is located in Southeast Europe on the Balkan Peninsula.
The capital city is Sofia, one of the oldest cities in Europe.
Bulgaria is famous for its rose oil production.
The country has a rich cultural history, with many UNESCO World Heritage sites.
The official language is Bulgarian.

name: Bahrain
facts: Bahrain is an island country in the Persian Gulf.
The capital city is Manama.
Bahrain is known for its financial sector and as a banking hub.
The country has a rich history, with ancient Dilmun civilization sites.
The official language is Arabic.

name: Burundi
facts: Burundi is a landlocked country in East Africa.
The capital city is Gitega, while Bujumbura was the former capital.
The country is known for its rich cultural heritage and traditions.
Burundi is famous for its drum culture and traditional music.
The official languages are Kirundi, French, and English.

name: Benin
facts: Benin is located in West Africa, bordered by Togo and Nigeria.
The capital city is Porto-Novo, but the largest city is Cotonou.
The country is known for its rich history as the birthplace of the Vodun religion.
Benin has a diverse culture with many ethnic groups.
The official language is French.

name: St-Barthélemy
facts: St-Barthélemy is a French overseas collectivity in the Caribbean.
The island is known for its white-sand beaches and luxury tourism.
The capital city is Gustavia, which has a charming harbor.
St-Barthélemy is famous for its annual yacht regatta.
The official language is French.

name: Bermuda
facts: Bermuda is a British Overseas Territory in the North Atlantic Ocean.
The capital city is Hamilton.
Bermuda is known for its pink sand beaches and clear blue waters.
The island has a subtropical climate and lush vegetation.
The official language is English.

name: Brunei
facts: Brunei is a small, wealthy nation located on the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia.
The capital city is Bandar Seri Begawan.
Brunei is known for its oil wealth and modern architecture.
The country has a rich Islamic culture and heritage.
The official language is Malay.

name: Bolivia
facts: Bolivia is a landlocked country in South America.
The capital city is Sucre, while La Paz is the administrative capital.
Bolivia is known for its diverse geography, including the Andes Mountains and Amazon rainforest.
The country has a rich indigenous culture and heritage.
The official languages are Spanish, Quechua, and Aymara.

name: Bonaire
facts: Bonaire is a special municipality of the Netherlands located in the Caribbean.
The island is known for its coral reefs and scuba diving spots.
Bonaire has a unique blend of Dutch and Caribbean cultures.
The capital city is Kralendijk.
The official languages are Dutch and Papiamento.

name: Brazil
facts: Brazil is the largest country in South America and the fifth largest in the world.
The capital city is Brasília, known for its modernist architecture.
Brazil is famous for its diverse ecosystems, including the Amazon rainforest.
The country is known for its vibrant culture, including samba and carnival.
The official language is Portuguese.

name: Bahamas
facts: The Bahamas is an archipelago in the Caribbean consisting of over 700 islands.
The capital city is Nassau, located on New Providence Island.
The Bahamas is known for its beautiful beaches and clear blue waters.
The economy relies heavily on tourism and offshore finance.
The official language is English.

name: Bhutan
facts: Bhutan is a landlocked country in the Eastern Himalayas.
The capital city is Thimphu, known for its unique architecture.
Bhutan is famous for its policy of Gross National Happiness.
The official language is Dzongkha.
The country is known for its stunning monasteries and landscapes.

name: British Virgin Is.
facts: The British Virgin Islands is a territory in the Caribbean.
The capital city is Road Town on Tortola island.
The islands are known for their beautiful beaches and sailing opportunities.
The official language is English.
The territory has a vibrant marine life, making it popular for diving.

name: Botswana
facts: Botswana is a landlocked country in Southern Africa.
The capital city is Gaborone.
The country is famous for its wildlife and the Okavango Delta.
Botswana has one of the world's largest populations of elephants.
The official language is English, but Setswana is widely spoken.

name: Belarus
facts: Belarus is located in Eastern Europe, bordered by Russia and Poland.
The capital city is Minsk, known for its Soviet architecture.
The country has a rich cultural heritage with many UNESCO World Heritage sites.
Belarus is known for its vast forests and nature reserves.
The official languages are Belarusian and Russian.

name: Belize
facts: Belize is located on the northeastern coast of Central America.
The capital city is Belmopan, while Belize City is the largest city.
The country is known for its barrier reef and diverse ecosystems.
Belize has a rich history with ancient Mayan ruins.
The official language is English.

name: Canada
facts: Canada is the second-largest country in the world by land area.
The capital city is Ottawa, located in Ontario.
Canada is known for its stunning natural landscapes and national parks.
The country has two official languages: English and French.
Canada is famous for its maple syrup and multicultural society.

name: Br. Indian Ocean Ter.
facts: The British Indian Ocean Territory is located in the Indian Ocean, near the Maldives.
It includes the Chagos Archipelago, a group of seven atolls with over 60 islands.
The largest island, Diego Garcia, is home to a large U.S. military base.
The territory has no permanent population, only military personnel and contractors.
It is one of the 14 British Overseas Territories.

name: Dem. Rep. Congo
facts: The Democratic Republic of Congo is the second-largest country in Africa by area.
It is home to the Congo River, one of the longest rivers in the world.
The country has vast natural resources, including cobalt and diamonds.
The capital city is Kinshasa, which lies across the river from Brazzaville, the capital of the Republic of Congo.
Virunga National Park in the DRC is known for its mountain gorillas and diverse wildlife.

name: Central African Rep.
facts: The Central African Republic (CAR) is a landlocked country in Central Africa.
The official languages are French and Sango.
CAR is known for its rich biodiversity and is home to rainforests, savannas, and rivers.
The capital city, Bangui, is located along the Ubangi River.
The economy heavily relies on agriculture, with diamonds as a significant export.

name: Congo
facts: The Republic of Congo, often called Congo-Brazzaville, is located in Central Africa.
The capital city, Brazzaville, sits on the Congo River across from Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
The official language is French, but various indigenous languages are also spoken.
The country has vast rainforests and is rich in natural resources, including oil and timber.
The Congo River is one of the longest and deepest rivers in the world, critical to the region's ecology and economy.

name: Côte d'Ivoire
facts: Côte d'Ivoire, also known as Ivory Coast, is a country in West Africa with a rich cultural heritage.
The official capital is Yamoussoukro, while Abidjan serves as the economic and cultural center.
It is one of the world's largest producers of cocoa beans, vital to the global chocolate industry.
The country gained independence from France in 1960, and French remains the official language.
The Basilica of Our Lady of Peace in Yamoussoukro is one of the largest churches in the world.
